defs.docs: UDP bindings for `tokio`.

attributes.value: deny(missing_docs, missing_debug_implementations)
! UDP bindings for `tokio`.
! > **Note:** This crate is **deprecated in tokio 0.2.x** and has been moved
! > into[`tokio::udp`] behind the `udp` [feature flag].
! [`tokio::udp`]: https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/udp/index.html
! [feature flag]: https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/index.html#feature-flags
! This module contains the UDP networking types, similar to the standard
! library, which can be used to implement networking protocols.
! The main struct for UDP is the [`UdpSocket`], which represents a UDP socket.
! Reading and writing to it can be done using futures, which return the
! [`RecvDgram`] and [`SendDgram`] structs respectively.
! For convenience it's also possible to convert raw datagrams into higher-level
! frames.
! [`UdpSocket`]: struct.UdpSocket.html
! [`RecvDgram`]: struct.RecvDgram.html
! [`SendDgram`]: struct.SendDgram.html
! [`UdpFramed`]: struct.UdpFramed.html
! [`framed`]: struct.UdpSocket.html#method.framed

defs.name: UdpFramed
defs.docs:
A unified `Stream` and `Sink` interface to an underlying `UdpSocket`, using
 the `Encoder` and `Decoder` traits to encode and decode frames.

attributes.value: / A unified `Stream` and `Sink` interface to an underlying `UdpSocket`, using
/ the `Encoder` and `Decoder` traits to encode and decode frames.
/ Raw UDP sockets work with datagrams, but higher-level code usually wants to
/ batch these into meaningful chunks, called "frames". This method layers
/ framing on top of this socket by using the `Encoder` and `Decoder` traits to
/ handle encoding and decoding of messages frames. Note that the incoming and
/ outgoing frame types may be distinct.
/ This function returns a *single* object that is both `Stream` and `Sink`;
/ grouping this into a single object is often useful for layering things which
/ require both read and write access to the underlying object.
/ If you want to work more directly with the streams and sink, consider
/ calling `split` on the `UdpFramed` returned by this method, which will break
/ them into separate objects, allowing them to interact more easily.
must_use = "sinks do nothing unless polled"

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Create a new `UdpFramed` backed by the given socket and codec.

attributes.value: / Create a new `UdpFramed` backed by the given socket and codec.
/ See struct level documentation for more details.

defs.docs:
Create a new `UdpFramed` backed by the given socket and codec. That will
 continue to call `decode_eof` until the decoder has cleared the entire buffer.

attributes.value: / Create a new `UdpFramed` backed by the given socket and codec. That will

defs.docs: Returns a reference to the underlying I/O stream wrapped by `Framed`.

attributes.value: / Returns a reference to the underlying I/O stream wrapped by `Framed`.
/ # Note
/ Care should be taken to not tamper with the underlying stream of data
/ coming in as it may corrupt the stream of frames otherwise being worked
/ with.

defs.name: RecvDgram
defs.docs: A future used to receive a datagram from a UDP socket.

attributes.value: / A future used to receive a datagram from a UDP socket.
/ This is created by the `UdpSocket::recv_dgram` method.
must_use = "futures do nothing unless polled"

defs.docs: The socket

attributes.value: / The socket

defs.name: buffer
defs.docs: The buffer

attributes.value: / The buffer

defs.name: into_parts
defs.docs: Consume the `RecvDgram`, returning the socket and buffer.

attributes.value: / Consume the `RecvDgram`, returning the socket and buffer.
/ # extern crate tokio_udp;
/ use tokio_udp::UdpSocket;
/ # pub fn main() {
/ let socket = UdpSocket::bind(&([127, 0, 0, 1], 0).into()).unwrap();
/ let mut buffer = vec![0; 4096];
/ let future = socket.recv_dgram(buffer);
/ // ... polling `future` ... giving up (e.g. after timeout)
/ let parts = future.into_parts();
/ let socket = parts.socket; // extract the socket
/ let buffer = parts.buffer; // extract the buffer
/ # Panics
/ If called after the future has completed.

defs.name: SendDgram
defs.docs: A future used to write the entire contents of some data to a UDP socket.

attributes.value: / A future used to write the entire contents of some data to a UDP socket.
/ This is created by the `UdpSocket::send_dgram` method.
must_use = "futures do nothing unless polled"

defs.docs: An I/O object representing a UDP socket.

attributes.value: / An I/O object representing a UDP socket.

defs.name: bind
defs.docs:
This function will create a new UDP socket and attempt to bind it to
 the `addr` provided.

attributes.value: / This function will create a new UDP socket and attempt to bind it to
/ the `addr` provided.

defs.name: from_std
defs.docs: Creates a new `UdpSocket` from the previously bound socket provided.

attributes.value: / Creates a new `UdpSocket` from the previously bound socket provided.
/ The socket given will be registered with the event loop that `handle`
/ is associated with. This function requires that `socket` has previously
/ been bound to an address to work correctly.
/ This can be used in conjunction with net2's `UdpBuilder` interface to
/ configure a socket before it's handed off, such as setting options like
/ `reuse_address` or binding to multiple addresses.
/ Use `Handle::default()` to lazily bind to an event loop, just like `bind` does.

defs.name: local_addr
defs.docs: Returns the local address that this socket is bound to.

attributes.value: / Returns the local address that this socket is bound to.

defs.name: connect
defs.docs:
Connects the UDP socket setting the default destination for send() and
 limiting packets that are read via recv from the address specified in
 `addr`.

attributes.value: / Connects the UDP socket setting the default destination for send() and
/ limiting packets that are read via recv from the address specified in
/ `addr`.
deprecated(since = "0.1.2", note = "use poll_send instead")

defs.name: poll_send
defs.value: pub fn poll_send(&mut Self, &[u8]) -> Poll<usize, io::Error>
defs.docs: Sends data on the socket to the remote address to which it is connected.

attributes.value: / Sends data on the socket to the remote address to which it is connected.
/ The [`connect`] method will connect this socket to a remote address. This
/ method will fail if the socket is not connected.
/ [`connect`]: #method.connect
/ # Return
/ On success, returns `Ok(Async::Ready(num_bytes_written))`.
/ If the socket is not ready for writing, the method returns
/ `Ok(Async::NotReady)` and arranges for the current task to receive a
/ notification when the socket becomes writable.
/ # Panics
/ This function will panic if called from outside of a task context.
deprecated(since = "0.1.2", note = "use poll_recv instead")

defs.name: poll_recv
defs.value: pub fn poll_recv(&mut Self, &mut [u8]) -> Poll<usize, io::Error>
defs.docs:
Receives a single datagram message on the socket from the remote address to
 which it is connected. On success, returns the number of bytes read.

attributes.value: / Receives a single datagram message on the socket from the remote address to
/ which it is connected. On success, returns the number of bytes read.
/ The function must be called with valid byte array `buf` of sufficient size to
/ hold the message bytes. If a message is too long to fit in the supplied buffer,
/ excess bytes may be discarded.
/ The [`connect`] method will connect this socket to a remote address. This
/ method will fail if the socket is not connected.
/ [`connect`]: #method.connect
/ # Return
/ On success, returns `Ok(Async::Ready(num_bytes_read))`.
/ If no data is available for reading, the method returns
/ `Ok(Async::NotReady)` and arranges for the current task to receive a
/ notification when the socket becomes receivable or is closed.
/ # Panics
/ This function will panic if called from outside of a task context.
deprecated(since = "0.1.2", note = "use poll_send_to instead")

defs.name: poll_send_to
defs.value: pub fn poll_send_to(&mut Self, &[u8], &SocketAddr) -> Poll<usize, io::Error>
defs.docs:
Sends data on the socket to the given address. On success, returns the
 number of bytes written.

attributes.value: / Sends data on the socket to the given address. On success, returns the
/ number of bytes written.
/ This will return an error when the IP version of the local socket
/ does not match that of `target`.
/ # Return
/ On success, returns `Ok(Async::Ready(num_bytes_written))`.
/ If the socket is not ready for writing, the method returns
/ `Ok(Async::NotReady)` and arranges for the current task to receive a
/ notification when the socket becomes writable.
/ # Panics
/ This function will panic if called from outside of a task context.

defs.name: send_dgram
defs.value:
pub fn send_dgram<T>(Self, T, &SocketAddr) -> SendDgram<T> where
T: AsRef<[u8]>
defs.docs:
Creates a future that will write the entire contents of the buffer
 `buf` provided as a datagram to this socket.

attributes.value: / Creates a future that will write the entire contents of the buffer
/ `buf` provided as a datagram to this socket.
/ The returned future will return after data has been written to the
/ outbound socket. The future will resolve to the stream as well as the
/ buffer (for reuse if needed).
/ Any error which happens during writing will cause both the stream and
/ the buffer to get destroyed. Note that failure to write the entire
/ buffer is considered an error for the purposes of sending a datagram.
/ The `buf` parameter here only requires the `AsRef<[u8]>` trait, which
/ should be broadly applicable to accepting data which can be converted
/ to a slice.

defs.name: recv_from
defs.value: pub fn recv_from(&mut Self, &mut [u8]) -> io::Result<(usize, SocketAddr)>

attributes.value: deprecated(since = "0.1.2", note = "use poll_recv_from instead")

defs.name: poll_recv_from
defs.value:
pub fn poll_recv_from(&mut Self, &mut [u8])
-> Poll<(usize, SocketAddr), io::Error>
defs.docs:
Receives data from the socket. On success, returns the number of bytes
 read and the address from whence the data came.

attributes.value: / Receives data from the socket. On success, returns the number of bytes
/ read and the address from whence the data came.
/ # Panics
/ This function will panic if called outside the context of a future's
/ task.

defs.name: recv_dgram
defs.value: pub fn recv_dgram<T>(Self, T) -> RecvDgram<T> where T: AsMut<[u8]>
defs.docs:
Creates a future that receive a datagram to be written to the buffer
 provided.

attributes.value: / Creates a future that receive a datagram to be written to the buffer
/ provided.
/ The returned future will return after a datagram has been received on
/ this socket. The future will resolve to the socket, the buffer, the
/ amount of data read, and the address the data was received from.
/ An error during reading will cause the socket and buffer to get
/ destroyed.
/ The `buf` parameter here only requires the `AsMut<[u8]>` trait, which
/ should be broadly applicable to accepting data which can be converted
/ to a slice.

defs.name: poll_read_ready
defs.value: pub fn poll_read_ready(&Self, mio::Ready) -> Poll<mio::Ready, io::Error>
defs.docs: Check the UDP socket's read readiness state.

attributes.value: / Check the UDP socket's read readiness state.
/ The mask argument allows specifying what readiness to notify on. This
/ can be any value, including platform specific readiness, **except**
/ `writable`.
/ If the socket is not ready for receiving then `Async::NotReady` is
/ returned and the current task is notified once a new event is received.
/ The socket will remain in a read-ready state until calls to `poll_recv`
/ return `NotReady`.
/ # Panics
/ This function panics if:
/ * `ready` includes writable.
/ * called from outside of a task context.

defs.name: poll_write_ready
defs.docs: Check the UDP socket's write readiness state.

attributes.value: / Check the UDP socket's write readiness state.
/ If the socket is not ready for sending then `Async::NotReady` is
/ returned and the current task is notified once a new event is received.
/ The I/O resource will remain in a write-ready state until calls to
/ `poll_send` return `NotReady`.
/ # Panics
/ This function panics if called from outside of a task context.

defs.docs: Gets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_broadcast`].
/ [`set_broadcast`]: #method.set_broadcast

defs.name: set_broadcast
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.
/ When enabled, this socket is allowed to send packets to a broadcast
/ address.

defs.name: multicast_loop_v4
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_multicast_loop_v4`].
/ [`set_multicast_loop_v4`]: #method.set_multicast_loop_v4

defs.name: set_multicast_loop_v4
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ If enabled, multicast packets will be looped back to the local socket.
/ # Note
/ This may not have any affect on IPv6 sockets.

defs.name: multicast_ttl_v4
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_multicast_ttl_v4`].
/ [`set_multicast_ttl_v4`]: #method.set_multicast_ttl_v4

defs.name: set_multicast_ttl_v4
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.
/ Indicates the time-to-live value of outgoing multicast packets for
/ this socket. The default value is 1 which means that multicast packets
/ don't leave the local network unless explicitly requested.
/ # Note
/ This may not have any affect on IPv6 sockets.

defs.name: multicast_loop_v6
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_multicast_loop_v6`].
/ [`set_multicast_loop_v6`]: #method.set_multicast_loop_v6

defs.name: set_multicast_loop_v6
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ Controls whether this socket sees the multicast packets it sends itself.
/ # Note
/ This may not have any affect on IPv4 sockets.

defs.name: ttl
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_TTL` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_TTL` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_ttl`].
/ [`set_ttl`]: #method.set_ttl

defs.name: set_ttl
defs.docs: Sets the value for the `IP_TTL` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value for the `IP_TTL` option on this socket.
/ This value sets the time-to-live field that is used in every packet sent
/ from this socket.

defs.name: join_multicast_v4
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ This function specifies a new multicast group for this socket to join.
/ The address must be a valid multicast address, and `interface` is the
/ address of the local interface with which the system should join the
/ multicast group. If it's equal to `INADDR_ANY` then an appropriate
/ interface is chosen by the system.

defs.name: join_multicast_v6
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IPV6_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IPV6_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ This function specifies a new multicast group for this socket to join.
/ The address must be a valid multicast address, and `interface` is the
/ index of the interface to join/leave (or 0 to indicate any interface).

defs.name: leave_multicast_v4
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IP_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IP_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ For more information about this option, see [`join_multicast_v4`].
/ [`join_multicast_v4`]: #method.join_multicast_v4

defs.name: leave_multicast_v6
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IPV6_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IPV6_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ For more information about this option, see [`join_multicast_v6`].
/ [`join_multicast_v6`]: #method.join_multicast_v6
